author: atoulme

author: yorickdowne
content: Erigon supports it now. Both Besu and Nethermind have open PRs, and can finish those and activate them when they see fit. I'd expect all clients will support eth/66 when Geth drops eth/65.

author: yorickdowne
content: OpenEthereum supports eth/66 as well, for those that are still running it.

author: mariusvanderwijden

author: mariusvanderwijden
content:
Alright I think I figured it out, seems the miner included a transaction that shouldn't be valid, probably a mev mixup
`insufficient funds for gas * price + value: address 0x821Aa130F4f2EAa36eBaD81FDcc575E3Fe01d9BD have 2214934226160000 want 2500000000000000`
Three tx in block 0 contain this address, two (tx 3 and 5) send funds from it and one sends funds to it (tx 14) 
In the canonical chain the transactions were confirmed in different blocks in the order 3 - 14 - 5, so the miner (`0xaa48d34cb80f6d6c8ae6d5f90ca6f88114421e54`) probably reordered them in an invalid way
